name: Workflow Histroy
report_script:
# Define columns
columns = [
    {"label": "DocType", "fieldname": "ref_doctype", "fieldtype": "Link", "options": "DocType", "width": 130},
    {"label": "Document Name", "fieldname": "docname", "fieldtype": "Dynamic Link", "options": "ref_doctype", "width": 160},
    {"label": "Property", "fieldname": "property", "fieldtype": "Data", "width": 200},
    {"label": "Old Value", "fieldname": "old_value", "fieldtype": "Data", "width": 180},
    {"label": "New Value", "fieldname": "new_value", "fieldtype": "Data", "width": 180},
    {"label": "Version ID", "fieldname": "version_id", "fieldtype": "Link", "options": "Version", "width": 120},
]

result = []

# Simple query
try:
    sql = "SELECT name as version_id, ref_doctype, docname, data FROM `tabVersion` ORDER BY creation DESC LIMIT 20"
    versions = frappe.db.sql(sql, as_dict=True)
    
    for ver in versions:
        data_text = ver.get("data", "")
        if data_text and data_text.startswith("{") and data_text.endswith("}"):
            try:
                # Simple JSON parsing - assuming structure
                import json
                data_obj = json.loads(data_text)
                
                # Get changed fields
                changed_list = data_obj.get("changed", [])
                
                # Process each change
                for change_item in changed_list:
                    # Very basic check - just try to access indices
                    try:
                        # Check if it has at least 3 elements by trying to access them
                        test = change_item[2]  # Try to access third element
                        
                        # If we get here, it has at least 3 elements
                        fieldname_val = change_item[0]
                        old_val = change_item[1]
                        new_val = change_item[2]
                        
                        result.append({
                            "ref_doctype": ver.get("ref_doctype", ""),
                            "docname": ver.get("docname", ""),
                            "property": str(fieldname_val) if fieldname_val is not None else "",
                            "old_value": str(old_val) if old_val is not None else "",
                            "new_value": str(new_val) if new_val is not None else "",
                            "version_id": ver.get("version_id", "")
                        })
                    except:
                        # Skip if doesn't have enough elements
                        continue
                        
            except:
                # Skip if JSON parsing fails
                continue
                
except:
    # Error row
    result.append({
        "ref_doctype": "Error",
        "docname": "Could not fetch data",
        "property": "",
        "old_value": "",
        "new_value": "",
        "version_id": ""
    })

data = columns, result
